144 struct RunInfo
145 {
146  // the current testing id
147  chaos::uni::UTF8String id;
148  // whether the tests should be run in a single process or not
149  bool single_proc;
150  // whether the test is being run as a sub-process of a parent testing
151  // process
152  bool sub_proc;
153  // the paths to the tests to run
154  std::set< chaos::uni::UTF8String > paths;
155  // whether the standard output stream is being used
156  bool use_stdout;
157  // information for stdout
158  OutInfo stdout_info;
159  // mapping from file path to write to, to the format to use
160  std::map< chaos::uni::UTF8String, OutInfo* > files;
161 
162  RunInfo()
163  :
164  single_proc( false ),
165  sub_proc ( false ),
166  use_stdout ( true ),
167  stdout_info( 3, TestLogger::OUT_PRETTY_TEXT )
168  {
169  }
170 };
171 
178 class TestCore
179 {
180 public:
181 
182  //-------------------------------CONSTRUCTOR--------------------------------
183 
191  TestCore(
192  const chaos::uni::UTF8String& path,
193  UnitTest* unit_test,
194  const chaos::uni::UTF8String& file,
195  chaos::int32 line,
196  bool module = false,
197  RunInfo* run_info = NULL )
198  {
199  try
200  {
201  // run tests
202  if ( run_info )
203  {
204  TestCore::setup( run_info );
205  TestCore::run( run_info );
206  TestCore::teardown( run_info );
207  return;
208  }
209 
210  // module declaration
211  if ( module )
212  {
213  TestCore::declare_module( path, file, line );
214  return;
215  }
216 
217  // unit declaration
218  TestCore::declare_unit( path, unit_test, file, line );
219  }
220  // invalid pass errors are handled by main
221  catch ( const chaos::test::ex::InvalidPathError& e )
222  {
223  throw e;
224  }
225  catch ( chaos::test::ex::TestError& e )
226  {
227  // TODO: should this go to loggers?
228  std::cerr << e.get_message() << std::endl;
229  throw e;
230  }
231  }
232 
233  //-------------------------STATIC VARIABLE GETTERS--------------------------
234 
235  static TestLogger& logger()
236  {
237  static TestLogger l;
238  return l;
239  }
240 
241  static std::map< chaos::uni::UTF8String, UnitTest* >& test_map()
242  {
243  static std::map< chaos::uni::UTF8String, UnitTest* > t_m;
244  return t_m;
245  }
246 
247  static std::set< chaos::uni::UTF8String >& base_modules()
248  {
249  static std::set< chaos::uni::UTF8String > b_m;
250  return b_m;
251  }
252 
253  static std::set< chaos::uni::UTF8String >& known_modules()
254  {
255  static std::set< chaos::uni::UTF8String > k_m;
256  return k_m;
257  }
258 
259  static chaos::uni::UTF8String& current_module()
260  {
261  static chaos::uni::UTF8String c_m;
262  return c_m;
263  }
264 
265 private:
266 
267  //-------------------------PRIVATE MEMBER FUNCTIONS-------------------------
268

274  const chaos::uni::UTF8String& file,
275  chaos::int32 line );

401 #define CHAOS_TEST_MODULE( path ) \
402  namespace \
403  { \
404  chaos::test::internal::TestCore t( #path, NULL, "", 0, true ); \
405  }
406 
412 #define CHAOS_TEST_UNIT( name ) \
413  CHAOS_TEST_UNIT_FIXTURE( name, chaos::test::Fixture )
414 
443 #define CHAOS_TEST_UNIT_FIXTURE( name, fixture_type ) \
444  namespace \
445  { \
446  struct name : public chaos::test::internal::UnitTest \
447  { \
448  fixture_type* fixture; \
449  name() : UnitTest( #name ), fixture( new fixture_type() ){} \
450  virtual ~name(){ delete fixture; } \
451  virtual chaos::test::Fixture* get_fixture() { return fixture; } \
452  virtual void execute(); \
453  }; \
454  static chaos::test::internal::TestCore object_##name ( \
455  #name, new name(), __FILE__, __LINE__ ); \
456  } \
457  void name::execute()

468 #define CHAOS_TEST_MESSAGE( message ) \
469  chaos::test::internal::TestCore::logger().write_message( message )
470 
477 #define CHAOS_CHECK_TRUE( a ) \
478  if ( ( a ) ) \
479  { \
480  chaos::test::internal::TestCore::logger().report_check_pass( \
481  "CHAOS_CHECK_TRUE", __FILE__, __LINE__ ); \
482  } \
483  else \
484  { \
485  chaos::test::internal::TestCore::logger().report_check_fail( \
486  "CHAOS_CHECK_TRUE", __FILE__, __LINE__, "" ); \
487  }
488 
495 #define CHAOS_CHECK_FALSE( a ) \
496  if ( !( a ) ) \
497  { \
498  chaos::test::internal::TestCore::logger().report_check_pass( \
499  "CHAOS_CHECK_FALSE", __FILE__, __LINE__ ); \
500  } \
501  else \
502  { \
503  chaos::test::internal::TestCore::logger().report_check_fail( \
504  "CHAOS_CHECK_FALSE", __FILE__, __LINE__, "" ); \
505  }
506 
512 #define CHAOS_CHECK_EQUAL( a, b ) \
513  { \
514  auto _a = ( a ); auto _b = ( b ); \
515  if ( _a == _b ) \
516  { \
517  chaos::test::internal::TestCore::logger().report_check_pass( \
518  "CHAOS_CHECK_EQUAL", __FILE__, __LINE__ ); \
519  } \
520  else \
521  { \
522  chaos::uni::UTF8String f_e_m; \
523  f_e_m << _a << " does not equal " << _b; \
524  chaos::test::internal::TestCore::logger().report_check_fail( \
525  "CHAOS_CHECK_EQUAL", __FILE__, __LINE__, f_e_m ); \
526  } \
527  }
528 
535 #define CHAOS_CHECK_NOT_EQUAL( a, b ) \
536  { \
537  auto _a = ( a ); auto _b = ( b ); \
538  if ( _a != _b ) \
539  { \
540  chaos::test::internal::TestCore::logger().report_check_pass( \
541  "CHAOS_CHECK_NOT_EQUAL", __FILE__, __LINE__ ); \
542  } \
543  else \
544  { \
545  chaos::uni::UTF8String f_e_m; \
546  f_e_m << _a << " equals " << _b; \
547  chaos::test::internal::TestCore::logger().report_check_fail( \
548  "CHAOS_CHECK_NOT_EQUAL", __FILE__, __LINE__, f_e_m ); \
549  } \
550  }
551 
559 #define CHAOS_CHECK_FLOAT_EQUAL( a, b ) \
560  { \
561  auto _a = ( a ); auto _b = ( b ); \
562  if ( chaos::math::float_equals( _a, _b ) ) \
563  { \
564  chaos::test::internal::TestCore::logger().report_check_pass( \
565  "CHAOS_CHECK_FLOAT_EQUAL", __FILE__, __LINE__ ); \
566  } \
567  else \
568  { \
569  chaos::uni::UTF8String f_e_m; \
570  f_e_m << _a << " does not equal " << _b; \
571  chaos::test::internal::TestCore::logger().report_check_fail( \
572  "CHAOS_CHECK_FLOAT_EQUAL", __FILE__, __LINE__, f_e_m ); \
573  } \
574  }
575 
583 #define CHAOS_CHECK_FLOAT_NOT_EQUAL( a, b ) \
584  { \
585  auto _a = ( a ); auto _b = ( b ); \
586  if ( !chaos::math::float_equals( _a, _b ) ) \
587  { \
588  chaos::test::internal::TestCore::logger().report_check_pass( \
589  "CHAOS_CHECK_FLOAT_NOT_EQUAL", __FILE__, __LINE__ ); \
590  } \
591  else \
592  { \
593  chaos::uni::UTF8String f_e_m; \
594  f_e_m << _a << " does not equal " << _b; \
595  chaos::test::internal::TestCore::logger().report_check_fail( \
596  "CHAOS_CHECK_FLOAT_EQUAL", __FILE__, __LINE__, f_e_m ); \
597  } \
598  }
599 
606 #define CHAOS_CHECK_THROW( statement, exception_type ) \
607  { \
608  bool caught = false; \
609  try \
610  { \
611  ( statement ); \
612  } \
613  catch( exception_type e ) \
614  { \
615  caught = true; \
616  chaos::test::internal::TestCore::logger().report_check_pass( \
617  "CHAOS_CHECK_THROW", __FILE__, __LINE__ ); \
618  } \
619  catch( ... ) {} \
620  if ( !caught ) \
621  { \
622  chaos::uni::UTF8String f_e_m; \
623  f_e_m << "Exception type: " << #exception_type << " not thrown"; \
624  chaos::test::internal::TestCore::logger().report_check_fail( \
625  "CHAOS_CHECK_THROW", __FILE__, __LINE__, f_e_m ); \
626  } \
627  }
